title: It's a long shot- but buying CHEAP T-206s
author: Ed_Hutchinson

posts.post_title: It's a long shot- but buying CHEAP T-206s
posts.post_content:
Looking for stuff in the 5.00-8.00 per card range. Backs dont matter. Obviously condition will be low, but I would like the card to be intact on the front- back paper loss is totally fine.

If this doesnt work, no worries, but please no bashing me for my prices. If you would like to sell some at this price, awesome! If not, that is totally understandable!

Thanks!

Ed

When you said 5-8, I thought you were talking condition.

Best of luck 5-8 in the $$$ range.

[quote name="sreader3" post=1530341]When you said 5-8, I thought you were talking condition.

Best of luck 5-8 in the $$$ range.[/QUOTE]

Im not expecting much, but maybe I can find a few. if not, it never hurts to ask, right?
You might be able to find a couple but they will chopped out and probably have no back, but it does happen once in a while.

On Sunday I will be listing a lot of 10 messed up T206 cards for auction on the BST to end on Thursday 4/28, including a Marquard.  Maybe you bid, maybe you get lucky...?  Until then, check out my other lots of lower condition T206 for auction in the BST section.

Brian
